item.title: Fall 2019 - We're Back!
item.description: .col3 { columns: 2 100px; -webkit-columns: 2 100px; -moz-columns: 2 100px; } via GIPHY We‚Äôre back! Welcome back to another year of #RLadies #LdnOnt! This year we are starting out with three NEW organizers of R-Ladies London: Olivia, Caitlin and Daryn. A little bit about us: All three of us are 4th year combined speech-language pathology MClSc/PhD candidates (yes, we met through that!).

item.title: Upcoming workshop: Data cleaning and exploration in R
item.description: Join us for our last R-Ladies #LdnOnt meet up of the season! Quick deets! ‚ùì What is R-Ladies? A low-key get together for people interested in using and learning more about R, a powerful statistical software program. We meet about once a month to feature different topics and speakers. üïõ When: Thursday, May 30, 5:30 - 7:30 p.m. üìçWhere: London Public Library, Central Branch (251 Dundas, right downtown). We will be in the Lawson Room on the first floor, across from the main library entrance (formerly known as the Richmond Room).

item.title: SPSS 2 R: Materials
item.description: See you next year, R-Ladies! And thus concludes our final R-Ladies #LdnOnt event of 2018! Thanks to Daryn for leading our last workshop of the season, Transitioning from SPSS to R, version 2.0. We were a smaller crowd this time (that‚Äôs the end of the academic term, for you), but I think these are a great set of resources to have. SPSS 2 R: Two for the price of one!

item.title: Looking for presenters for this coming year of R-Ladies #LdnOnt
item.description: Know some R? Share with our team! As we gear up for our third year of R-Ladies #LdnOnt, we are actively looking for people who would be interested in presenting a tutorial at one of our future meet ups. Our presenters have ranged from relatively new R users all the way up to seasoned R experts; the ideal R-Ladies tutorial presenter would fall anywhere along that continuum! Goal: Skill-swapping Our main goal is to provide an environment in which people interested in learning R can share their skills and learn with other like-minded folks.

item.title: Workshop: Making Science Open With R!
item.description: üéâ Next meet up: Making Science Open with R! Led by @monsauce. üéâ Learn about how #rstats, #rmarkdown, and Google Sheets can work together for you to create a reproducible workflow. Join us on June 26 at 5pm at the @LondonPublicLib! All are welcome. https://t.co/fZN2Atoxv6 pic.twitter.com/C6HjqCYbG2 ‚Äî R-Ladies LdnOnt (@RLadiesLdnOnt) June 6, 2018 Details Join us for our last meet up until the fall! We are thrilled to have Monica Granados back with us again to close out our second year!

item.title: Welcome to our new landing site!
item.description: Welcome to the new landing site of R-Ladies London, Ontario! The R-Ladies London, Ontario chapter (aka R-Ladies #LdnOnt) has been in operation since January 2017. Check out this post to learn more about how we got started and where we are now. This site will serve as a central landing point for anyone wishing to know more about us or access our materials. What is this R-Ladies you speak of?
